Essential equipment
Warm and waterproof clothing, a map, compass and good navigation skills are essential, and in addition to the standard equipment for country walks, you should also carry:
- A survival bag - a heavy-duty bag that keeps your body insulated from the cold in an emergency.
- A torch and spare batteries
- A whistle (six blasts of a whistle or six flashes of a torch is the international distress signal)
- Additional warm clothing (including hat and gloves)
- High-energy rations (such as mint cake, chocolate, or dried fruit)
- Water purification tablets\n
- A first aid kit
- An ice axe and crampons when there is snow or ice on the hills
If you are likely to encounter heavy snow or ice, wear a pair of heavy-duty winter walking boots that can be fitted with crampons (metal spike attachments that give a better grip on icy terrain) and carry an ice axe. How To Use MunRoamer
- Navigate through the app using the hamburger menu with the 3 lines at the top of the screen
-Use the MunRoam map to find Munros nearby your location and search for Munros by name like 'Ben Nevis'. - Get some handy hiking advice by clicking on the 'Before You Roam' option in the menu
- Add a diary entry of your ascents once you have bagged a Munro in the 'My Bag' option
